text: was a village located in Tone District, Gunma Prefecture, Japan. As of 2003, the village had an estimated population of 3,736 and a density of 132.67 persons per km². The total area was 28.16 km². On February 13, 2005, Shirasawa, along with the village of Tone (also from Tone District), was merged into the expanded city of Numata. ==External links== * Official website of Numata (some English) Category:Dissolved municipalities of Gunma Prefecture
title: Shirasawa, Gunma
